text: Gardner is a city in Johnson County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 23,287 people there. It is in the Kansas City metropolitan area. ==Geography== Gardner is at (38.812358, -94.926291). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ===Climate=== Gardner has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Gardner has a humid subtropical climate. It is abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Gardner, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says there were 23,287 people, 8,005 households, and 5,938 families living in Gardner. Of the households, 66.1% owned their home and 33.9% rented their home. The median age was 32.6 years. Of the people, 79.2% were White, 3.9% were Black, 1.8% were Asian, 0.6% were Native American, 0.1% were Pacific Islanders, 3.6% were from some other race, and 10.8% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 10.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says there were 19,123 people, 6,644 households, and 4,938 families living in Gardner. ==References== ==Other websites== * City of Gardner * Gardner - Directory of Public Officials * The Gardner News * Gardner City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:1857 establishments in Kansas Territory
title: Gardner, Kansas
